thread.title: Watch a Badass Man-Bear Smash Things in Russian Superhero Movie ‘Guardians’
thread.title_full: Watch a Badass Man-Bear Smash Things in Russian Superhero Movie ‘Guardians’

author: Daniel Pearson
title: Watch a Badass Man-Bear Smash Things in Russian Superhero Movie ‘Guardians’
text:
Russia’s mad, bad, and completely outrageous superhero movie, Guardian s, has a final trailer before its release later this year — and it features a machine gun-toting man-bear.
The movie, which is basically Avengers on crack, is the country’s latest attempt to copy and better the wild superhero universes of DC and Marvel. It follows a team of Cold War-era (of course it’s Cold War era) guardians — Ler, Ursus, Khan and Xenia — whose powers supposedly reflect the strengths and traditions of the people of the Soviet Union. Their mission is to fight and destroy August Kuratov, who, if you squint, kind of looks like Bane.
We don’t know whether it’ll be any good, but what we do know is that it features a grizzly bear going fucking nuts with a high-powered machine gun. If that isn’t enough to give the trailer a watch, then we don’t know what is.
Guardians is set for release in Russia some time in February, but there’s no word yet of a U.S. or European premiere. Check out the latest trailer above, then the previous two below.


In other movie news, this Apple Watch stand looks like a mini retro Macintosh computer.
